sen.j: 伏見宮貞建親王（ふしみのみや さだたけしんのう、元禄13年12月21日 （1701年1月29日） - 宝暦4年7月21日 （1754年9月7日））は、江戸時代中期の皇族。
sen.e: Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Sadatake (January 29, 1701 - September 7, 1754) was a member of imperial family who lived in the middle of Edo period.
Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Sadatake (January 29, 1701 - September 7, 1754) was a member of the imperial family who lived during the middle of the Edo period.
Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Sadatake (January 29, 1701 - September 7, 1754) was a member of the Imperial Family who lived during the middle of the Edo period.
He was the fifteenth head of the Fushiminomiya family.
He was the fifteenth head of the Fushiminomiya family.
He was the fifteenth head of the Fushiminomiya family.

sen.j: 伏見宮邦永親王の第3王子。
sen.e: He was the third son of Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kuninaga.
He was the third son of Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kuninaga.
He was the third son of Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kuninaga.

sen.j: 母は、霊元天皇第5皇女福子内親王（よしこないしんのう）。
sen.e: His mother was Imperial Princess Yoshiko who was the fifth daughter of Emperor Reigen.
His mother was Imperial Princess Yoshiko who was the fifth daughter of Emperor Reigen.
His mother was Imperial Princess Yoshiko who was the fifth daughter of Emperor Reigen.
His childhood name was Wakamiya.
His childhood name was Wakamiya.
His childhood name was Wakamiya.

sen.j: 宝永5年（1708年）東山天皇の猶子となり、翌宝永6年（1715年）5月親王宣下を蒙り、貞建と命名される。
sen.e: In 1708, he became a yushi yushi (another child considered as one's own) of Emperor Higashiyama and received the Emperor's proclamation for being an Imperial Prince in May 1715 and named Sadatake.
sen.cmt: 猶子→yushi (another child considered as one's own)[http://tangorin.com/words/猶子]
sen.e: In 1708, he became a yushi (another child considered as one's own) of Emperor Higashiyama and received the Emperor's proclamation for being an Imperial Prince in May 1715 and was named Sadatake.

In 1708, he became a yushi (another child considered as one's own) of Emperor Higashiyama and received the Emperor's proclamation for being an Imperial Prince in June and July 1709 and was named Sadatake.

sen.j: 正徳 (日本)5年（1715年）10月元服し、兵部省に任ぜられる。
sen.e: In October 1715, he went through genpuku (ceremony o f attaining manhood) and was assigned to serve Hyobusho (the ministry in charge of military affairs).
sen.cmt: 元服→genpuku (ceremony o f attaining manhood) [http://tangorin.com/words/元服]兵部省→Hyobusho (the ministry in charge of military affairs)[定訳不明]
sen.e: In October 1715, he went through genpuku (ceremony of attaining manhood) and was assigned to serve Hyobusho (the ministry in charge of military affairs).
In October and November 1715, he went through genpuku (ceremony of attaining manhood) and was assigned to serve Hyobusho (the ministry in charge of military affairs).
sen.cmt: スペース削除グレゴリ歴

sen.j: 享保4年（1719年）正月東山天皇の第1皇女秋子内親王と結婚。
sen.e: In January 1719, he married Imperial Princess Shushi (Akiko) who was the first daughter of Emperor Higashiyama.
In January 1719, he married Imperial Princess Shushi (Akiko) who was the first daughter of Emperor Higashiyama.
In February and March 1719, he married Imperial Princess Shushi (Akiko) who was the first daughter of Emperor Higashiyama.

sen.j: 享保12年（1727年）二品に叙され、宝暦4年（1754年）7月21日一品に叙せられるが、翌21日薨去。
sen.e: In 1727, he was given the rank of nihon (the second of Imperial Princes' ranks), then promoted to the rank of ippon (the first of Imperial Princes' ranks) on July 21, 1754 and passed away on the same day.
sen.cmt: 「翌」21日ではなく「同」21日として訳しました。
sen.e: In 1727, he was given the rank of nihon (the second rank for an Imperial Prince), then promoted to the rank of ippon (the first rank for an Imperial Prince) on July 21, 1754 and passed away on the same day.

In 1727, he was given the rank of nihon (the second rank for an Imperial Prince), then promoted to the rank of ippon (the first rank for an Imperial Prince) on September 7, 1754 and passed away on the same day.
His age at death was 54.
His age at death was 54.
His age at death was 54.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Gokentokuin.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Gokentokuin.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Gokentokuin.

sen.j: 王子女に伏見宮邦忠親王のほか、伏見宮邦頼親王（尊宝入道親王）、尊英入道親王、尊真入道親王などがいる。
sen.e: His children were Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kunitada, Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kuniyori (priest-Imperial Prince Sonpo), priest-Imperial Prince Sonei and priest-Imperial Prince Sonshin.
His children were Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kunitada, Fushiminomiya Imperial Prince Kuniyori (priest-Imperial Prince Sonpo), priest-Imperial Prince Sonei and priest-Imperial Prince Sonshin.
